Claudio Abbado - Berg: Lulu Suite. Altenberg Lieder. Three Pieces for Orchestra


Composed By: Alban Berg
Conductor: Claudio Abbado
Orchestra: The London Symphony Orchestra
Producer: Karl Faust
Soprano Vocals: Margaret Price (tracks: 3, 5, 9 to 13)
Notes: Recorded in December 1970, Anvill Films Studio, England.


Total time: 1:06:32


These are among the most sheerly beautiful performances of Berg's music ever recorded, the textures exquisitely balanced, the string playing suavely refined, the Mahlerian elegiac passages eloquently expressed. Margaret Price sings with immaculate purity, a little earnestly, perhaps, in Lulu's song, but with fine responsiveness to the subtly chiselled lines of the Altenberg songs (of which, by the way, this is the only currently available recording). Abbado's readings have great energy (the two Lulu entr'actes are powerfully dramatic) and are acutely alive to the iridescent shiftings both of instrumental colour and of expressive intensity that are so characteristic of Berg (thus Abbado, too, is at his very finest in the elusive, evanescent Altenberg songs).
